layer.name: Discipline
layer.definition: Do what needs doing, especially when you don't feel like it.

questions.text: When my alarm goes off for morning devotion time, I ...
questions.principle: Eat the Frog: Do the most important thing first

answers.4: usually make it, only missing occasionally when legitimately disrupted
answers.5: get up — it's non-negotiable even when I don't feel like it
answers.2: consistently hit snooze or skip it
answers.3: get up some mornings, but tiredness or busyness often wins
answers.1: don't have a set devotion time — spiritual practice happens whenever I think of it

questions.text: My time for prayer and Scripture reading is ...

answers.4: mostly protected — I only adjust for genuine emergencies
answers.5: firm — other demands work around it, not the other way around
answers.2: vague and easily overridden by anything else
answers.3: scheduled but frequently gets bumped for work, family, or other demands
answers.1: nonexistent — I pray and read when the mood strikes or not at all

questions.text: When I miss a day of spiritual disciplines, I ...
questions.principle: Order from chaos, getting back up

answers.4: usually return the next day, though I still feel some unnecessary guilt
answers.5: note it, examine why, and show up the next day without drama
answers.2: beat myself up, which makes returning harder and less likely
answers.3: sometimes bounce back quickly, other times spiral into guilt and extended absence
answers.1: usually let it turn into weeks — guilt makes me avoid trying again

questions.text: My approach to Sabbath rest is ...

answers.4: mostly protected, though I occasionally cheat with 'small' work tasks
answers.5: sacred — I rest intentionally and without guilt
answers.2: aspirational — I can't stop the mental churn and work bleeds into every day
answers.3: inconsistent — I try but often fill it with errands or feel guilty
answers.1: nonexistent — I work until I crash, then recover, then repeat

questions.text: My follow-through on spiritual commitments (church, small group, serving) is ...
questions.principle: Commitment to the 'why' even when 'what' is hard

answers.4: reliable most of the time, only missing for legitimate conflicts or illness
answers.5: in ink — I show up as committed regardless of convenience
answers.2: inconsistent — I frequently bail due to tiredness, weather, or competing plans
answers.3: about half the time — depends on how I'm feeling that week
answers.1: convenience-based — I skip when anything else comes up
